name: Hotel Riu Montego Bay

reviews.text: I'm not sure who gave this a 5 Star rating but the RIU in Montego Bay is not a 5 Star hotel.
reviews.title: Its not a 5 Star...If you like plane spotting, great but RIU Montego Bay...Never Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There was a group of 8 of us who all arrived at different times after 3pm. Check in times ranged from 30mins to 2 1/2 hours. and as one of our group pointed out it should be a basic function of a hotel to assign a bedroom but it was chaotic.
reviews.title: Do not waste your time! Bad Management!
A great vacation!
reviews.text: There was simply no organisation in the check in process. Rooms were not available for hours, they could not tell if previous customers were still in the room and some of the group were given rooms that were not cleaned and when this reported to housekeeping, the house keeper when arriving to inspect the room told one of our group that "they should not have checked into the room" as if we had selected the rooms to check into.

We were told the problems we were individually having were one off's and never normally happened but the one off's happened to 8 of us and we could see the same disorganisation the following day at check in with other arriving customers.
reviews.title: Best Vacation Ever!!!

reviews.text: Interestingly enough the hotel is on the landing and take off flight paths of Montego Bay International airport (see pictures). If you are interested in hearing & seeing a variety of airplanes (from private jets to A737's) taking off & landing throughout the day then this is the resort for you.
reviews.title: Would never stay again!!!

reviews.text: After reading the most recent reviews on this resort with one person saying they posted so they could talk others out of staying there, I will give you the flip side of the coin.
reviews.title: Positive experience for us

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While staying at RIU Ocho Rios last week they offered to switch guests over to RIU MoBay because it is newer and they're trying to promote it. While we loved the RIU Ochi, our sense of adventure got the best of us and we decided to switch over thus experiencing two resorts on one trip. The drive over only took an hour and twenty mins. Check in took ten minutes and since we had left our bathing suits on (the switch was at noon) we never missed a beat and were in the pool with a cocktail in hand before you could hum the chorus of "One Love".
reviews.title: OK if you're an anorexic insomniac

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They booked us into an ocean front room at no extra cost...love it! Beautiful view so I got some lovely sunset photos from our balcony. Room was always clean, pillows soft and fluffy, firm bed just how I like it and great water pressure. Was disappointed no screens on patio doors so we did an experiment on first night, left our door ajar so we could hear the surf and sleep in night Caribbean air with just the sheer curtain pulled close and it was great. (upper floor of course) no bugs came in at all. Perfect!
reviews.title: Loved it! Had the best honeymoon ever...

reviews.text: Food was good in buffet, Mexican night was best. We tried to book into an ala carte but they were full (no surprise since we were only going to be there for 2 and a half days and they book 4 days out) However on our last night we showed up at the Italian restaurant, smiled and asked if we could dine there even though we had no reservation and the host gave us the one empty table...nice. It was good with great tiramisu. I'm not usually a breakfast eater but did so on our last day before taking off to airport...fantastic danish and muffins...between the food and wonderful rum cream....ooh the vacation lbs. show up. Aquacise classes and walking can only do so much :)
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel - poor service, trashy place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff here was friendly, especially the pool swim up bar staff..hilarious even though they're so busy. They truly enjoy their jobs (or they're faking it quite well) and always smiled when you slip a tip into their palm. Never did our service suffer if we happened not to tip at that moment. All the guests I talked to seemed to be enjoying themselves. Saw several weddings too...really pretty.
reviews.title: You could not pay me to stay at the RIU Montego Bay

reviews.text: I went with my sister for 5 nights in May. I have traveled all over the world in a professional and tourist capacity for 26 years and would say this is probably a 3.5 on the scale. I would compare this to a cruise ship, with free drinks. We are single and are 32/43…. We found the resort to be made up of mostly couples, married folks and families (not too many kids). I don’t think we met any singles less the college group of about 6 the first day.
reviews.title: Inexpensive Vacation...dial it back and relax!

reviews.text: Our travel company was Apple. The flight in was uneventful less the delay in Miami due to weather. We were supposed to be in Jamaica at 8:20pm and did not arrive until 11:30. Then had to go through customs and wait on vans/buses to be organized. We arrived at the hotel at approx 1230am after all this. It is close to the airport as everyone knows, approximately 10 minutes. For those complaints about hearing/seeing planes throughout the day….irrelevant input…this was not a surprise being this close to the airport.
reviews.title: This Riu Hotel doesn't serve the Riu reputation well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in was rather smooth. No punch/drink though. We finally got to our room at 1:00am and luggage was right behind us. Appears that they do things by paperwork rather than computer which makes things more complicated in my opinion.
reviews.title: great for those of us who aren't spoiled

reviews.text: Room: It was nice and well kept. I think we had a view of what appeared to be a swamp....however, we did not spend much time in the room at all. Yes it did have the mildew smell, but we are on the beach. I took a travel size Lysol and that helped out quite a bit. Bar fully stocked, water is in large bottles (3). We drank a lot of water so that was fairly well stocked for us. There were mosquitoes in our room. The only thing I can figure on this is that the cleaning ladies may have opened the balcony doors when cleaning; we kept them closed when we were in the room. We definitely used the safe in the room and it was easy to operate. The tiles on the balcony/in the bathroom are slick when wet….be careful…I did a gravity check on the balcony after it rained…those tiles are not made for outdoor/rain situations:)
reviews.title: NOT 5 Star

reviews.text: Food: I am a picky eater and do not experiment. So take my comments with a grain of salt. As noted by most; the breakfast is the best meal of the day. Coffee could be better. Could not get in to any of the specialty restaurants, they were all booked from the moment we arrived. I did try some pasta at one of the buffets and was not so impressed so not sure if that was a sample of the Italian restaurant. Jerk Chicken on the beach; had that and it was good. Basically, you will find something to eat and will not starve. Afterhours food has a lot to be desired; the sports bar is the only place to grab something and there is only self serve popcorn, some bite size sandwiches, and nachos to an extent…I think that was about it.
reviews.title: Save your money and go elsewhere

reviews.text: We just returned on May 31st. We met family and friends there, for a wedding. This "resort" is only about a five minute drive from the airport. Our flight arrived late, so check - in was no problem. The staff was friendly. Food was only ok, nothing to cheer about. At lunch time you can get jerk chicken in rice on the beach, it was very good. We booked our tour from an agent named Erica, with Tropical Tours. She was very professional and did not hustle you around like the other tour agents in the lobby. She usually arrives in the lobby around 3pm. As far as the rooms, the are very damp, but keep in mind you are in Jamaica After the reading previous reviews, I packed my own sheets. I did not see any bugs on their sheets, but sprayed it downed just in case. The bed was hard and not that comfortable. Mosquitoes are very bad, so bring bug spray . The rooms were fairly clean each day, and that's very important. Most people should know not to leave your valuable items out in your room. This is our 2nd trip to Jamacia, if you have a choice, go to Ocho Rios. I only stayed here because we decided to be with the wedding party, but I would not return to this resort. If you get a good deal, go for it. It's not that bad, if you are not a very picky person.
reviews.title: Just OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having heard all of the horror stories about check in at Riu Montego Bay, we really tried to have it together. They gave us the wrong room to start with. Spent hours between them and the travel agent and more $$$ to get upgraded to an ocean view.
reviews.title: Lock EVERYTHING up! Their rules are different!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room smelledmbadly of bug spray and musty. It never did get completely comfortable temp wise and the cleaning people kept turning the electricity to the room off. There were small bugs on our sheets and the inside of the comforter had hair on it. We put the comforter in the closet. My husband went across the street, out of the resort, to get bug spray. They have none in the resort!!! He was accosted by drug dealers from the time he left the resort until the time he reentered the resort! It was very uncomfortable for him.
reviews.title: All Riu's are not the same

reviews.text: We then sprayed ourselves and the sheets with bug spray.
reviews.title: Longish review - but honest and to the point

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The sheets were 180 count max!!! No way they were more. Everyone we ran in to said the same thing! The beds are VERY hard and so are the pillows!
reviews.title: Had an Amazing Time!!

description: * Opening September 2008 * Located in Montego Bay, on Jamaica's northwest coast * On the beachfront * Complimentary sun loungers on the beach * 2-story main building and 3-story and 4-story annexes * Surrounded by 40,000 m2 / 47,840 sq. yards of lush gardens * 4.5 km / 2.8 miles from Montego Bay * 350 m / 114.8 ft from various shops * 2,7 km / 1.7 miles from Montego Bay airport * Credit cards accepted: MasterCard, Amex, Visa
